questiontext.text:
[[lang code="de"]]

Untersuchen Sie, welche der folgenden Abbildungen Gruppenhomomorphismen sind.
(Hinweis: \( + \) und \( * \) meint die komponentenweise Addition und Multiplikation.)

a) \(\varphi_1: (\mathbb{R}^2,+)\to(\mathbb{R}^2,+) \)
\(\varphi_1(x,y)=({@p11@},{@p12@}) \)
\( \varphi_1 \) ist Gruppenhomomorphismus: [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

Check which of the following images are group homomorphisms.
(Note: \( + \) and \( * \) means the component-wise addition and multiplication.)

(a) \(\varphi_1: (\mathbb{R}^2,+)\to(\mathbb{R}^2,+) \)
\(\varphi_1(x,y)=({@p11@},{@p12@}) \)
\( \varphi_1 \) is group homomorphism: [[/lang]][[input:ans1]][[lang code="de"]] [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]] [[/lang]][[validation:ans1]][[lang code="de"]]
b) \(\varphi_2: (\mathbb{Q}^2,+)\to(\mathbb{Q}^2,+) \)
\(\varphi_2(x,y)=({@p21@},{@p22@}) \)
\( \varphi_2 \) ist Gruppenhomomorphismus: [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]
(b) \(\varphi_2: (\mathbb{Q}^2,+)\to(\mathbb{Q}^2,+) \)
\(\varphi_2(x,y)=({@p21@},{@p22@}) \)
\( \varphi_2 \) is group homomorphism: [[/lang]][[input:ans2]][[lang code="de"]] [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]] [[/lang]][[validation:ans2]][[lang code="de"]]
c) \(\varphi_3: (\mathbb{Z}^2,+)\to(\mathbb{Z}^2,+) \)
\(\varphi_3(x,y)=({@p31@},{@p32@}) \)
\( \varphi_3 \) ist Gruppenhomomorphismus: [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]
(c) \(\varphi_3: (\mathbb{Z}^2,+)\to(\mathbb{Z}^2,+) \)
\(\varphi_3(x,y)=({@p31@},{@p32@}) \)
\( \varphi_3 \) is group homomorphism: [[/lang]][[input:ans3]][[lang code="de"]] [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]] [[/lang]][[validation:ans3]][[lang code="de"]]
d) \(\varphi_4: ((\mathbb{Q}\setminus\{0\})^2,*)\to((\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\})^2,*) \)
\(\varphi_4(x,y)=({@p41@},{@p42@}) \)
\( \varphi_4 \) ist Gruppenhomomorphismus: [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]
(d) \(\varphi_4: ((\mathbb{Q}\setminus\{0\})^2,*)\to((\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\})^2,*) \)
\(\varphi_4(x,y)=({@p41@},{@p42@}) \)
\( \varphi_4 \) is group homomorphism: [[/lang]][[input:ans4]][[lang code="de"]] [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]] [[/lang]][[validation:ans4]][[lang code="de"]]
[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]
[[/lang]]

prtcorrect.text: [[lang code="de"]]Richtige Antwort, gut gemacht![[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]Right answer, well done![[/lang]]

prtpartiallycorrect.text: [[lang code="de"]]Ihre Antwort ist teilweise korrekt.[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]Your answer is partly correct.[[/lang]]

falsefeedback.text:
[[lang code="de"]]

\( \varphi_1\) ist kein Gruppenhomomorphismus, denn es existieren \( v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in \mathbb{R}^2\) mit

\(\begin{align}\varphi_1(v+w) &= ({@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p11))@},\;\ {@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p12))@}) \\ &\neq({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p11))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p12))@})+({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p11))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p12))@}) \\ &= \varphi_1(v)+\varphi_1(w) \end{align} \)


[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

\( \varphi_1\) is not a group homomorphism, because there exist \( v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in \mathbb{R}^2\) with

\(\begin{align}\varphi_1(v+w) &= ({@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p11))@},\;\ {@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p12))@}) \\ &\neq({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p11))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p12))@})+({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p11))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p12))@}) \\ &= \varphi_1(v)+\varphi_1(w) \end{align} \)


[[/lang]]

[[lang code="de"]]

\( \varphi_2\) ist ein Gruppenhomomorphismus, denn es gilt

\(\begin{align}\varphi_2(v+w) &= ({@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p21))@},\;\ {@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p22))@}) \\ &=({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p21))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p22))@})+({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p21))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p22))@}) \\ &= \varphi_2(v)+\varphi_2(w) \end{align} \\ \forall\ v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in \mathbb{Q}^2  \)


[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

\( \varphi_2\) is a group homomorphism, because it applies

\(\begin{align}\varphi_2(v+w) &= ({@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p21))@},\;\ {@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p22))@}) \\ &=({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p21))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p22))@})+({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p21))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p22))@}) \\ &= \varphi_2(v)+\varphi_2(w) \end{align} \\ \forall\ v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in \mathbb{Q}^2  \)


[[/lang]]

[[lang code="de"]]

\( \varphi_3\) ist kein Gruppenhomomorphismus, denn es existieren \( v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in \mathbb{Z}^2\) mit

\(\begin{align}\varphi_3(v+w) &= ({@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p31))@},\;\ {@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p32))@}) \\ &\neq({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p31))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p32))@})+({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p31))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p32))@}) \\ &= \varphi_3(v)+\varphi_3(w) \end{align} \)


[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

\( \varphi_3\) is not a group homomorphism, because there exist \( v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in \mathbb{Z}^2\) with

\(\begin{align}\varphi_3(v+w) &= ({@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p31))@},\;\ {@subst((v1+w1),x,subst((v2+w2),y,p32))@}) \\ &\neq({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p31))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p32))@})+({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p31))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p32))@}) \\ &= \varphi_3(v)+\varphi_3(w) \end{align} \)


[[/lang]]

truefeedback.text:
[[lang code="de"]]

\( \varphi_4\) ist ein Gruppenhomomorphismus, denn es gilt

\(\begin{align}\varphi_4(v*w) &= ({@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p42))@}) \\ &=({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p42))@})*({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p42))@}) \\ &= \varphi_4(v)*\varphi_4(w) \end{align} \\ \forall\ v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in (\mathbb{Q}\setminus\{0\})^2  \)



[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

\( \varphi_4\) is a group homomorphism, because it applies

\(\begin{align}\varphi_4(v*w) &= ({@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p42))@}) \\ &=({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p42))@})*({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p42))@}) \\ &= \varphi_4(v)*\varphi_4(w) \end{align} \\ \forall\ v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in (\mathbb{Q}\setminus\{0\})^2  \)



[[/lang]]

falsefeedback.text:
[[lang code="de"]]

\( \varphi_4\) ist kein Gruppenhomomorphismus, denn es existieren \( v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in (\mathbb{Q}\setminus\{0\})^2\) mit

\(\begin{align}\varphi_4(v*w) &= ({@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p42))@}) \\ &\neq({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p42))@})*({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p42))@}) \\ &= \varphi_4(v)*\varphi_4(w) \end{align} \)



[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

\( \varphi_4\) is not a group homomorphism, because there exist \( v=(v_1,v_2)^T,\ w=(w_1,\ w_2)^T  \in (\mathbb{Q}\setminus\{0\})^2\) with

\(\begin{align}\varphi_4(v*w) &= ({@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst((v1*w1),x,subst((v2*w2),y,p42))@}) \\ &\neq({@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(v1,x,subst(v2,y,p42))@})*({@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p41))@},\;\ {@subst(w1,x,subst(w2,y,p42))@}) \\ &= \varphi_4(v)*\varphi_4(w) \end{align} \)



[[/lang]]
